metadata.title: Shodan - Enrich Incident IPs and Domain Names
metadata.description: When a new sentinel incident is created, this playbook gets triggered and fetches geo location and running services details for IP addresses and domain names from Shodan.io.
prerequisites: 1. Prior to the deployment of this playbook, Shodan Custom Connector needs to be deployed under the same subscription.
2. Refer to [Shodan Logic App Custom Connector](../../CustomConnector/ShodanCustomConnector/readme.md) documentation for deployment instructions.

metadata.description: Name of the logic app connector which performs Shodan actions.

body.message:
Geo and Service details for IP Address/Domain from Shodan.io:
@{variables('IncidentComment')}

inputs.name: IncidentComment
inputs.value: There is some issue with playbook. Please check the playbook for detailed error.

inputs.name: IncidentComment
inputs.value: Domain @{split(items('For_each_Domain_IP'), ':')[0]} couldn't be found on Shodan.io.

Afp.description: The Apple File Protocol (AFP) is used by Apple devices to share files across the network.

examples.name: Apple file servers that allow cleartext authentication

Afp.title: Afp

Bgp.description: BGP services that respond to a peering request

examples.name: BGP services that successfully peered with the Shodan crawlers

Bgp.title: Bgp

Cassandra.description: Cassandra databases that allow Thrift connections
Cassandra.title: Cassandra

examples.name: Services running in the AWS cloud
Services running in the Microsoft Azure cloud
Services running in the Google cloud (GCP)
DNS services that run on UDP and allow recursive lookups. Depending on their configuration they could be used for amplification DDoS attacks.
DNS services running on either TCP or UDP that allow recursive lookups

Docker.description: Docker services that allow remote connections and dont have authentication enabled.

examples.name: Docker services exposed to the Internet

Docker.title: Docker

examples.name: FTP servers that allow anonymous login
Websites that have a security.txt file
Google websites as identified by the Google favicon
Websites that are behind a Citrix NetScaler web application firewall (WAF)

components.description: The web technologies (ex. jQuery) that a website uses.
components.title: Components

favicon.description: Favicon for the website. Helpful to find phishing websites, fingerprinting products or locating websites from the same vendor/ company.
favicon.title: Favicon

headers_hash.description: Numeric hash of the HTTP headers with the order preserved.
headers_hash.title: Headers Hash

html_hash.description: Numeric hash of the "http.html" property. Useful for finding other IPs with the exact same website.
html_hash.title: Html Hash

robots_hash.description: Numeric hash of the robots.txt file which can be used to find websites that have the same robots.txt.
robots_hash.title: Robots Hash

securitytxt.description: The security.txt file is an emerging standard for knowing how to contact the website owner for security issues.
securitytxt.title: Securitytxt

server.description: Short-hand for accessing the value from the "Server" HTTP header.
server.title: Server

waf.description: Web application firewall that is protecting this website.
waf.title: Waf

examples.name: Lantronix services that advertise their password
Active Directory controllers with LDAP support

Location.description: Physical location based on the IP address. Generally accurate to the city level. Don't consider the latitude/ longitude as accurate but rather rough location.

examples.name: Services in the state of Texas

Location.title: Location

examples.name: MySQL Servers with X Protocol Enabled
NTP services that return a list of recent connections which can be abused in DDoS reflection attacks
Remote Desktop Protocol services with additional encryption information
Remote Desktop services that have been hit with ransomware

labels.description: Labels describing the image based on machine learning
labels.title: Labels

text.description: Text extracted from image using OCR
text.title: Text

chain.description: List of certificates in PEM format
chain.title: Chain

cipher.description: Default cipher used for the connection
cipher.title: Cipher

handshake_states.description: Detailed breakdown of how the SSL/TLS connection was negotiated.
handshake_states.title: Handshake States

ja3s.description: JA3 fingerprint for the server SSL/TLS connection. Useful for pivoting or identifying SSL/TLS implementations.
ja3s.title: Ja3S

jarm.description: JARM fingerprint for the server SSL/TLS connection. Useful for pivoting or identifying SSL/TLS implementations.
jarm.title: Jarm

unstable.description: If the crawlers couldn't gather a property (ex. "versions") due to an unstable connection then the name of that property is added here.
unstable.title: Unstable

versions.description: The crawlers explicitly check every SSL/TLS version. If the server doesn't support a version then a "-" is in front of the version value.
versions.title: Versions

Tag.description: A tag is a string that can have one of the following values.
Tag.title: Tag

examples.name: Ubiquiti devices exposed to the Internet
Ubiquiti devices that have been compromised
VMware server software (includes Workstation, vCenter, ESXi and more)

_Shodan.description: The _shodan property contains information about how the banner was generated. It doesn't store any data about the port/ service itself.

examples.name: Find results that were collected by the "smtp" module

id.description: Unique ID of the banner; used in the "_shodan.options.referrer" to indicate when the current banner was generated as a result of another banner
id.title: Id

module.description: The initial protocol that the crawler used when talking to the service
module.title: Module

ptr.description: Whether or not the crawler has a PTR entry
ptr.title: Ptr

_Shodan.title: _Shodan

hostname.description: Hostname that was used to talk to the service (ex. for HTTP it would set the "Host:" header to this hostname)
hostname.title: Hostname

referrer.description: Banner ID that triggered the creation of the current banner
referrer.title: Referrer

scan.description: Unique scan ID that identifies the request that launched the scan
scan.title: Scan

examples.name: Services running in the 198.20.0.0/16 network range
Services that are vulnerable to Eternalblue

cpe.description: CPE information in the old, deprecated format.
cpe.title: Cpe

hash.description: Numeric hash of the "data" property which is helpful for finding other IPs with the exact same information.
hash.title: Hash

hostnames.description: Hostnames for the IP based on the PTR/ reverse DNS information.
hostnames.title: Hostnames

html.description: This property is deprecated. Use "http.html" instead.
html.title: Html

ip.description: Numeric IP address which can be more efficient for storing/ indexing.
ip.title: Ip

ip_str.description: String representation of the IP address. This is most likely what you want to use.
ip_str.title: Ip Str

opts.description: Stores experimental data before it has been finalized into a top-level property.
opts.title: Opts

org.description: Name of the organization that manages the IP
org.title: Org

product.description: Name of the software that powers the service.
product.title: Product

timestamp.description: Date and time that the banner was collected in UTC time.
timestamp.title: Timestamp

title.description: This property is deprecated. Use "http.title" instead.
title.title: Title
